intro: Pouteria latianthera, commonly known as the golden soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the soursop but has a distinct golden hue and a more acidic flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruit. The tree can reach heights of up to 10 meters and has a long lifespan, making it a valuable species in both horticulture and local agriculture.
